definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Psychologists could also identify the key ages that best allow for the memorization of classical texts.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家也可以幫助確定最適於記憶經典文本的年齡。

sentences.english: Psychologists and psychiatrists say that children should be handled with care.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家和精神病專家說孩子需要小心呵護。

sentences.english: This is what psychologists dream about at night.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家做夢也會夢到這些。

sentences.english: As psychologists we have to question the natural.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家要對自然而然的反應提出疑問。

sentences.english: This sentence pattern is actually a favorite of psychologists.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個句型是心理學家最喜歡用的。

sentences.english: One superpower all psychologists would kill for is the ability to read minds.
sentences.chinese: “讀心術”是每個心理學家都夢寐以求的超能力。

sentences.english: Whether perceived similarity will affect empathy is widely drawn attention by psychologists all the while.
sentences.chinese: 感知相似性對共情的影響一直受到心理學家們的關注。

sentences.english: Huang Xiting is a famous psychologist in contemporary China.
sentences.chinese: 黃希庭是當代中國著名的心理學家。

sentences.english: Even detectives and psychologists can spot a liar only about 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 就連偵探和心理學家也只能辨認出47%的說謊者。

sentences.english: The sexual allure of the facial scar has long puzzled psychologists.
sentences.chinese: 刀疤臉的性吸引力已經困擾了心理學家很長時間。

sentences.english: Alice was referred to a neuropsychologist for further examination.
sentences.chinese: 於是找了一位神經心理學家爲愛麗絲做進一步檢查。

sentences.english: Psychologists have found that fantasising about future success can be dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家發現，對未來成就的幻想是存在危險的。

sentences.english: Psychologists are pondering a new classification, called objectophilia or objectum-sexuals.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家正在研究一個新的課題叫“戀物症”。

sentences.english: Psychologists have long revealed the senselessness of such exaggerated regulation.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家已經揭示了過度的規定是無意義的。

sentences.english: For the first time in IQ testing, psychologists have found that female scores have risen above those of men.
sentences.chinese: 心理學家發現，女性智商測驗的分數首度超過了男性。

sentences.english: But clever psychologists have ruled this out.
sentences.chinese: 但聰明的心理學家已經排除這個原因了。

definition: surgeon/as opposed to physician 內科醫生|内科医生[nei4 ke1 yi1 sheng1], who works primarily by administering drugs
the Franks (Germanic people who arrived in Europe from 600 AD and took over France)
